alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson; Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 10 at 8:05PM MDT until June 10 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Yuma County in northeastern Colorado... Northeastern Kit Carson County in east central Colorado... Cheyenne County in northwestern Kansas... Sherman County in northwestern Kansas... * Until 900 PM MDT/1000 PM CDT/. * At 805 PM MDT/905 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Haigler to 9 miles southwest of St. Francis to 10 miles northwest of Kanorado, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Kanorado around 820 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Ruleton, Goodland and Bird City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 0 and 35. Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 435 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 181 and 195. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
